result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pleads Not Guilty, entered by court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Combined bond forfeited- $1000 in 14CF173.  $2500 combined bond reinstated. Arraignment scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Court authorizes warrant for arrest and orders forfeiture proceedings to begin on combined Bond.

Motion and Order to Withdraw as Attorney

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney McLaughlin motions to withdraw from 14CF19 specifically along with the others.    Mr. Cooper does not object to withdraw.  State makes no comment.  Court grants motion to withdraw.  PD needs to supply substitute counsel.  Bail continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant William C. Cooper in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Off the Record -  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court, in custody with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Moldenhauer motions to withdraw as counsel.  Defendant would like to hire a new attorney.  Court grants motion to withdraw.   Attorney Moldenhauer states he will contact Public Defender's Office.   Defendant brings up bail modification and asks for reduction.  Reads statement.  State opposes bond modification in these cases.  State asks that the bond continue as previously set.  Court goes through records.  Defendant's motion to modify bond is denied.  Bond remains.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William C. Cooper in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant William C. Cooper in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF wants to hire private counsel, motion to withdraw - DENIED by court, DEF wants to talk to court in person, state objects.  Court DEF needs to file appropriate motion, none filed yet.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant William Charles Cooper in court in custody by video with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer by phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Time limits waived for Preliminary Hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
